_description: Renters Insurance Sample Data - Use this template for creating renters insurance pages

data.intro_content: Renters insurance protects your belongings and provides liability coverage. California renters pay an average of just $180/year.
data.requirements_content: Not legally required, but most landlords require proof of renters insurance before leasing.

coverage_types.name: Personal Property
coverage_types.description: Covers your belongings from theft and damage

coverage_types.name: Liability
coverage_types.description: Protects if someone is injured in your rental

coverage_types.name: Loss of Use
coverage_types.description: Covers temporary housing after covered loss

faqs.question: Is renters insurance required?
faqs.answer: Not by law, but most landlords require it as a lease condition.

faqs.question: What does renters insurance cover?
faqs.answer: Personal property, liability, additional living expenses, and medical payments to others.
